direct_answer.text:
To simplify this product of cosines, let’s recall that each term represents the real part of an exponential function when expressed in Euler's form \( e^{ix} \). Specifically,

\[ e^{ix} = \cos(x) + i\sin(x) \]

Thus, our original problem translates into finding:
